sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A letter of a great victory obtained by Sir Miles Livesey, neer Kingstone, on Friday July 7. 1648. The Duke of Buckingham routed, where was slain, the Lord Francis Villers, the Duke of Bucking-hams brother Col. Tho. Howard, the Earle of Berkshires son, 20 officers and souldiers, the Earle of Holland hurt, 200 wounded, 200 horse taken, 100 taken prisoners, &c. Frierson, Henry.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Robert Ibbitson in Smithfield neere to the Queens-Head Tavern, London : [1648]
Signed at end of letter: Hen. Frierson. Publication date from Wing. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A letter of a great victory obtained by Sir Miles Livesey, neer Kingstone, on Friday July 7. 1648. The Duke of Buckingham routed, where was slain, the Lord Francis Villers, the Duke of Bucking-hams brother Col. Tho. Howard, the Earle of Berkshires son, 20 officers and souldiers, the Earle of Holland hurt, 200 wounded, 200 horse taken, 100 taken prisoners, &c. Frierson, Henry.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Robert Ibbitson in Smithfield neere to the Queens-Head Tavern, London : [1648]
Signed at end of letter: Hen. Frierson. Publication date from Wing. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Robert Ibbitson
Smithfield neere to the Queens-Head Tavern
